dct:title: Miami-Dade Septic System
dct:creator: Miami-Dade County
dct:license: Miami-Dade County provides this data for use "as is". The areas depicted by this map/data are approximate, and are not accurate to surveying or engineering standards. The maps/data shown here are for illustration purposes only and are not suitable for site-specific decision making. Information found here should not be used for making financial or any other commitments. Miami-Dade County provides this information with the understanding that it is not guaranteed to be accurate, correct or complete and conclusions drawn from such information are the sole responsibility of the user. dct:description: A collection of polygon features for all buildings within the Urban Development Boundary (UDB) and outside the UDB, approximately 938 square miles. The planimetric layer for Miami-Dade County was previously updated in 2015 byEarth Sciences and Resources Institute (ESRI). This feature class contains features extracted from LiDAR captured by GPI in 2018.
prov:action:
#########
# GDSC ETL is performed in two steps: shell script to ETL data into postgres
# and then additional transformations with SQL in postGIS (if needed).
####

#########
# Step 1 - bash script (pseudo code)
####

# create directory structure and move into it
mkdir -p /data/mdc_septic_systems/{download,etl} && cd /data/mdc_septic_systems

# set update flag based on last update and update frequency
do_update=0 if date() < last_update + update_frequency else do_update = 1

# download if update flag is set:
if do_update == 1 then
  ogr2ogr -nln mdc_septic_systems download/mdc_septic_systems.geojson "https://services.arcgis.com/8Pc9XBTAsYuxx9Ny/arcgis/rest/services/DOHSepticSystem_gdb/FeatureServer/0/query?outFields=*&where=1%3D1&outSR=4326&f=geojson"

# replace column names Shape__Length and Shape__Area to avoid conflict when
# providing as service on ArcServer.
sed -i 's/Shape__Length/shape_length/gI; s/Shape__Area/shape_area/gI' download/mdc_septic_systems.geojson

# load into postGIS with:
  ogr2ogr -lco GEOMETRY_NAME=geom -f PostgreSQL PG:"<postgres connection>" download/mdc_septic_systems.geojson -nlt point -nln mdc_septic_systems

#########
# Step 2 - SQL script (pseudo code):
####

# remove duplicate points and make geometries valid:
UPDATE mdc_septic_systems
  SET geom=ST_MakeValid(ST_RemoveRepeatedPoints(geom));"

# add local geometry column and reproject existing geometries into local EPSG:
SELECT AddGeometryColumn (
  'mdc_septic_systems',
  'geom_local',2236,'point',2
);
UPDATE mdc_septic_systems
  SET geom_local=ST_MakeValid(ST_RemoveRepeatedPoints(ST_Transform(geom,2236)));
CREATE INDEX mdc_septic_systems_geom_local_idx
  ON mdc_septic_systems
  USING GIST (geom_local);
NOTIFY pgrst, 'reload schema';"
dcat:contactPoint: University of Miami Libraries, Frost Institute for Data Science and Computing
